The actions are no longer located where they were originally.  Go to Import... and Export... on the File menu or the resource popup menu.

The error you're getting is somewhere in the validator.  Apparently the validator is having a problem with these files.  I will have to look into it tomorrow.

How do you get this error?  I'm trying to recreate the problem, and I can't tell if you are getting it from an editor, import, export, or validation?  I tried opening dataserver-instance.xml in the SML-IF editor and clicked the validate link within the editor and didn't see this error.
I don't know.. I noticed the exception in the log file. All I did was trying to open the smlif file in the editor and validate the content.

I wasn't able to reproduce this problem but I can see that you have already addressed the exception indirectly with another fix.  You are checking to ensure that the resource is null or does not exist.

i.e. instead of if (!associatedResource.exists()), you've changed it to if ((!associatedResource == null) || (!associatedResource.exists())).

Please mark the defect as either fixed or works for me.
ok, wasn't sure it was the same problem since i never saw the NPE in a console, just in the debugger
